info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 18 at 2:40AM CDT until June 19 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Ninnescah South Fork near Murdock affecting Kingman County.
Ninnescah River near Peck affecting Sedgwick and Sumner Counties.
Ninnescah River near Belle Plaine affecting Sumner County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ninnescah South Fork near Murdock.
* WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor overflow occurs along both banks. However, on the south side of the banks near the river bridge on SE 160th Avenue, flooding spreads out into pastureland to the extent of 1000ft.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 245 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING
